nodes.bodyText: I think you should restore this line, change it to toolVersion.setIsProduction(version.isFrozen()), then get rid of the else on line 162.
It doesn't look like procesImageDataforWorkflowVersions returns a null (nor should it), so this line is unnecessary.

I would get rid of this (see above comment). This is a side-effect and generally not a recommended practice -- I would expect a method with a signature like this to return a List, not return a List and modify an object.
This is fine, but in the future you might want to look at using map instead as an alternative and slightly more functional way (fix not required). And also for the outer loop.
I know it's for now, but this sort of scares me if we get distracted and don't come back to it. Is there a ticket for this?

Will pass if something horribly breaks and there are no versions, should have an assert that this is working as expected and that there are versions (and if I understand the intent, that that one of them should be the snapShottedVersionName)
